summary: mls side orlando city are the latest club to have expressed interest in manchester united misfit javier hernandez . southampton , stoke , west ham and everton are all interested with united willing to sell for around # 8million . the mexico international would be a huge commercial draw for the florida-based franchise who are coached by former everton and manchester city striker adrian heath .

explain: Orlando City football club, from Florida, has joined several other clubs in expressing interest in signing Manchester United's striker, Javier Hernandez, who is surplus to requirements at the English club. Orlando City seeks his potential as a commercial draw and could potentially be a good addition to their team under the guidance of Adrian Heath, a former player from Everton and Manchester City.
Orlando City has a large Latin-American fanbase, and Hernandez, being Mexican, would be a popular addition due to his cultural connection with their fanbase.
There are multiple clubs, including Southampton, Stoke, West Ham, Everton, Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio, and Inter Milan, showing interest in Hernandez.
